content: Hey @rylev I'm going to start porting the contributor survey into surveyhero now. Can I get an invite to the rust-lang survey hero team (which I assume exists)?
i'm gonna start setting up the survey on my personal account for now since I'm assuming I can transfer it to the team or something once I'm part of it

Jane Lusby [she/her] said:

Hey rylev I'm going to start porting the contributor survey into surveyhero now. Can I get an invite to the rust-lang survey hero team (which I assume exists)?

@Jane Lusby [she/her] can you DM which email your using for SurveyHero?

i went ahead and transferred ownership of the survey to your account since you were listed as an enterprise account in the team and it indicated that I couldn't add more than 10 questions to the survey without upgrading my account, and predictably I've lost access to the survey
so when you've got a chance @rylev could you give me access to the contributor survey again, hopefully this time it will let me add more questions
@Jane Lusby [she/her] You should have access again. Sorry for that!
Tyty
im sad there doesn't seem to be a way to use the surveyhero API to _set_ survey details
would be so cool if we could use the markdown as the master copy and just run some script to create/update the surveyhero survey based on it
sick, I've finished inputting the survey into surveyhero and setup all the display logic
now to figure out how to test it

Jane Lusby [she/her] said:

im sad there doesn't seem to be a way to use the surveyhero API to _set_ survey details

I've started engaging with the support (first about fetching translations so that we can do backups), and they have reached back out. If we can form a relationship, maybe the next thing we ask for is this
yess

@rylev would you have time to hop in a call and discuss planning for next steps? I'm unsure how much more effort I should put into polishing and feedback for the survey vs when I should start translations
and would like to hear about the process this year for the community survey since I figure mirroring it's progress is probably a safe starting point
@Jane Lusby [she/her] I'd have time in 35 minutes
perfect
@rylev could you also give me access to the community survey so I can use it as a reference for question structure consistency?
@Jane Lusby [she/her] done!
tyty
